column10: Unique Features / USP
M Lounge: VIP section rivals business class. Co-owned by Mahesh Babu. Best washrooms in the city. Hosted India's first HDR screening trial in 2025. Ultra-premium multiplex with disciplined crowd.

Largest Screen: Formerly IMAX. The PCX screen is the largest in India. A pilgrimage site for blockbusters. Screens so large they lack generic branding. Hosted a 70mm Oppenheimer revival in 2025. Blockbuster destination.
Renovated: Converted from single screen. Parking is tight; users often complain about AC rationing. Fan dances during openings. Popular Asian Cinemas property.
EPIQ Screen: 57ft wide screen brought premium PLF to the suburbs. Co-owned by Ravi Teja. Art-themed lobbies. First EPIQ PLF in Hyderabad.
Ad-Heavy: Notorious for 25-30 mins of ads. Primary hub for the KPHB IT/Settler crowd. One of Hyderabad's largest PVRs.
LED Tech: Screen 2 uses Samsung Onyx LED (no projector). Co-owned by Allu Arjun on the old Satyam site. Neon lounge. First LED cinema in Telangana.
New Entrant: Located in Aparna Neo Mall. Known for on-time screenings (fewer ads than PVR). Excellent seating comfort; modern build.
Megaplex: Brought the first Macro XE screen to North Hyderabad. Massive capacity. Comfortable suburban multiplex.
Petrol Theft: Infamous user review warning about bike petrol theft. Operator uses purple disco lights for songs. Famous FDFS fan celebrations.
Record Breaker: Twin to Mallikarjuna. Audio launch hub. If a record breaks in Nizam, it starts here. Part of iconic twin-theatre complex.
Local Hub: Serves the dense Miyapur residential belt. Known for decent screens but heavy ad loads. Infamous for 40-min ads. 2024 controversy regarding ads. Known for long ad breaks.
Recliner Heavy: Features planetarium-style recliners. Located in the re-branded Lulu (formerly Manjeera). High footfall mall cinema.
Rebranded: Formerly Radhika area mall screens. Now features recliners and a live kitchen. Affordable neighborhood multiplex.
Budget Plex: Popular with students. Affordable ticket pricing but average maintenance. Popular in Nizampet area.
Paper Snowstorms: Fans throw confetti in the laser beam. Epicenter of 4 AM benefit shows. Legendary RTC X Roads crowd.
The Twin: Adjacent to Brahmaramba. Often plays the 2nd big release or acts as spillover for blockbusters. Night shows extend for hits. Twin of Brahmaramba.
Refurbished: Old CineTown renovated by Miraj. Users praise the balanced bass and new interiors. Good maintenance & sound.
Tiny AF: User reviews frequently criticize the small screen sizes, calling them home theaters. Preferred for VFX films. Preferred East Hyderabad multiplex.
Legacy: One of the oldest multiplexes in IT corridor. Screens are smaller compared to newer malls. Oldest PVR in Hitech City.
Tech Survivor: Upgraded to 4K to compete. The only major single screen standing in Erragadda. Showroom tie-ins. Strong neighborhood following.
Attapur Savior: First major multiplex for the Attapur/Mehdipatnam bridge area. Family crowd. Serves Attapur belt.
Metro Connected: Directly linked to Metro. Screen 1 & 8 are cited as having superior projection. Direct metro access.
New & Clean: Located near Tank Bund. Praised for fresh interiors and good sound isolation. Blue sofas lobby. One of INOX's best-maintained venues.
Local Favorite: Competes with Cinepolis Mantra. Known for better mass movie vibes in a multiplex setting. LED lobby displays. First premium multiplex in Attapur.
Spillover: Often gets the crowd that can't find tickets at AMB Cinemas nearby. Marathon events. IT crowd oriented.
New Opening: Opened Jan 2024. Launched by the Hanuman movie team. Main multiplex for RC Puram.
Loud Audio: Known for cranking volume to max for mass songs. Black marketing of tickets reported. Fan cutouts tradition. Classic fan-theatre.
Premium Specs: All screens reportedly laser. Located at the busy Y-Junction. Consistent INOX quality.
Quiet: Located in a quieter mall, often easier to get tickets here than other IT corridor halls. Less crowded premium option.
Sold Out Theory: Users suspect they block online tickets to force offline sales/save commission. Hosted a live actor Q&A inside the hall. Old IT-area single screen.
PXL Screen: Features a massive curved screen with dual projection. PVR's answer to Prasads. PVR's best large-format screen.
Controversial: Branded Luxury but users complain screens are very small. Audio calibration is top-tier. Hosted Hyderabad's first Atmos-tuned concert screening. Quiet luxury experience.
Hybrid: Built on old Rajyalaxmi theater site. Screen 1 retains the massive single-screen size. Revived historic theatre.
Elite Crowd: Salt & pepper crowd. High ticket prices, gourmet food focus. One of the first INOXs. Posh crowd; aging tech.
Hidden Gem: Locals rate its AV quality higher than many multiplexes. Renovated recently. Key Malkajgiri theatre.
Mass Belt: Located in the heart of Dilsukhnagar. Frequent complaints about AC maintenance. Popular in East Hyderabad.
800-Seater: Screen 1 has ~801 seats, effectively a single screen inside a multiplex shell. Grand single-screen feel.
The Sidekick: Smaller than 70mm but shares the same violent fan energy and tech upgrades. Rare Atmos 35mm hall.
Ghost House: User reviews describe Nagendra as a ghost house due to emptiness/dilapidation. Neighborhood favorite.
IT Hub: Serves the Financial District. Modern, clean, standard corporate multiplex experience. Convenient IT-hub cinema.
One Week Run: Movies rotate very fast. Tickets are cheap (~₹50-100). Health-themed promos (due to Nursing home tie). Last big hall in Miyapur.
Deceptive Name: It's fully digital 4K. Reduced seats years ago to install couple seats & legroom. Considered best single screen in Hyderabad.
Sound Quality: Users specifically praise the sound in Screen 2. Located near Lakdikapul metro. Excellent sound calibration.
Transit Hub: Located next to the MGBS bus station. High footfall from transit passengers. Bus + metro connectivity.
Cockroaches: Reviews cite poor maintenance despite Multiplex tag. Screen 1 is still very large. Affordable local multiplex.
Industrial Zone: Serves Jeedimetla workers. Users report AC being switched off mid-movie. Community groups. Local cultural hub.
Neighborhood Plex: Good sound, but often overshadowed by the nearby Asian/Miraj properties. Maruti showroom tie. Comfortable seating.
Heritage: Renamed/Renovated. Combines old-school balcony seating with digital projection. IDBI Bank promos. Very old Kachiguda cinema.
Reliable: One of the oldest PVRs. Known as idiot-proof for its consistency over the years. Heavy footfall.
AC Issues: Frequent complaints of management turning off AC to save power. Opposite TVS Motors. Main RC Puram fan theatre.
Chef Corner: Features live food prep and seat delivery. Luxury island in industrial Balanagar. Well-balanced Miraj property.
Luxury: New opening. Features Beanary Café and gold-themed interiors for the rich suburbs. Opened September 2025. Serves fast-growing suburb.
Traffic Jam: The cultural heart of ECIL. Parking entry often blocks the main road. ECIL landmark theatre.
Recliner Heavy: Took over old Cinepolis space in SLN Terminus. Markets almost every seat as Recliner. 2024 upgrade added haptic seats. Seat-shaking bass. Quiet IT crowd.
Star Owned: Originally owned by Ramanaidu family. Premium location, quiet crowd. Former Cinemax flagship.
Unique Build: The mall was built around the old Maheshwari/Parmeshwari theaters. Huge audis. Preserved legacy screens.
Audiophile: First theater to gross ₹1Cr in AP. Steep balcony for perfect sightlines. Perfect sound. Legendary sound quality.
Legacy Name: Often referred to interchangeably with Asian CineSquare or as a specific screen within it. Indane Gas service tie. Strong fan following.
Modern: Brought laser projection and Atmos to the industrial Nacharam area. Budget-friendly.
Audio Bleed: Users report sound leaking between screens. Extreme screen is the highlight. Military ties. Busy Secunderabad multiplex.
Cleanliness: Praised for hygiene in a dense residential area. Standard Cinepolis quality. Good acoustics.
Transformation: The legendary Shalini/Shivani twins converted into a modern Miraj multiplex. Revived classic.
Budget Luxury: Cheat Code theater offering recliner seats at single-screen prices. Historic Tarakarama revival.
New: Located in a new mall. Good sound isolation and modern projection. Direct metro access.
Loud: Reviews claim sound is so loud it can be heard outside the building.
Surprise Tech: Deep in a residential colony but sports 4K Atmos specs. Rare Atmos single-screen.
Student Hub: Renamed from Pratap. Serves the engineering college belt. Steep balcony. Old City icon.
Hybrid: Retains the local name Geeta but managed by Miraj standards. Modernized legacy cinema.
Old City Entry: Rare global chain presence in the Old City. Taking over the old Sudha theater. Old City favorite.
Average: Standard mall multiplex. Often less crowded than PVRs. Czech Colony vibes. Balanced AV quality.
Hygiene: Praised for cleanliness after Miraj takeover, a major issue in its previous avatar. Neighborhood staple.
Budget: Serves the railway colony area. Basic digital projection. Secunderabad local crowd.
Smell Issues: Users specifically complain about a bad smell upon entry. Mass crowd. Working-class fan culture.
Student Favorite: Popular with Osmania University students. Praised for fragrance (rare!). Nacharam landmark.
Hidden Plex: A modern multiplex hidden inside a traditional neighborhood complex. Small loyal audience.
Rebranded: Glitterati tag attempts to upscale this heritage theater. Operated by Mukta A2. Part of legendary RK group.
Renovated: Recently upgraded interiors. Located near the Passport office. Recently renovated.
Highway Hub: Saves Medchal locals from driving 15km to Kompally. Medchal's main cinema.
The Original: The classic screen, distinct from the Glitterati rebrand/renovation. One of Hyderabad's most iconic cinemas.
Decaying: Needs renovation. Paint vanished. Early adopter of PayTm ticketing. Local favorite.
Mosquitoes: User reviews praise sound but complain heavily about mosquitoes. Major Uppal fan theatre.
Private: Ultra-small screens (one has 37 seats). Designed for private parties/rentals. Upscale crowd.
Airport Hub: Key entertainment for airport staff. Renovated with Amazon cement tiles. Rare laser upgrade near airport.
Capacity: Massive seating capacity. Competes with Cineplanet on price. Classic Alwal cinema.
Gold Upgrade: The 70mm screen is branded Gold to highlight 4K tech. No snacks (only chips). Modernized version.
Standard: The base version of the theater, often confused with Gold. Fan celebrations hub.
Interruptions: Users complain about frequent pauses/interruptions during shows. Affordable option.
Ad Revenue: High ad engagement. Serves Srisailam highway/Airport corridor. Key Tukkuguda cinema.
Vintage: Classic 70mm that refused to split. Popular with OU students. Residential-area staple.
Black & White: Projection bulb so dim users say color movies look B&W. Old city vibe. Old City budget cinema.
The Survivor: Overshadowed by Sandhya/Devi but installed 4K to stay relevant. RTC overflow giant.
Rowdy: Security issues reported (drunken people). Far outskirts. Primary local cinema.
Border Post: Brings AC cinema to the extreme outskirts, replacing touring talkies. Recently upgraded.
Live Kitchen: North Indian chain's debut. Features a live kitchen to gentrify Nampally. Opened December 19, 2025. New-age boutique multiplex.
Future: 4 screens with country's largest Dolby Cinema. Expected January 2026 (tied to Avatar release).
Future: 8 screens at RTC X Roads (Odeon Mall). Opening by January 2026.
Future: 9 screens with premium options at Lakeshore Mall. By January 2026.
Future: 7 screens at Aparna Mall, Shamshabad. March 2026.
